subject: Science
text: Environment is a home for microscopic organisms to giant organisms like blue whale, elephant, banyan, peepal, etc. On the basis of structure of cell, body structure, mode of nutrition, presence or absence of cell wall etc., Robert Harding Whittaker classified these organisms into five kingdoms.

subject: Science
text: The five kingdom classification system includes: Monera, Protista, Fungi, Plantae, and Animalia.

subject: Science
text: No cell wall or cell wall made of peptidoglycan

text: Classes: Pisces, Amphibia, Reptilia, Aves, Mammalia

subject: Science
text: Bacteria: Prokaryotic, no nucleus | Euglena: Eukaryotic, has nucleus

subject: Science
text: Bacteria: No chloroplasts | Euglena: Has chloroplasts (can photosynthesize)

subject: Science
text: Mushroom: No chlorophyll | Fern: Has chlorophyll

subject: Science
text: Fish: Gills, two-chambered heart | Whale: Lungs, four-chambered heart

text: According to five kingdom classification, which kingdom do bacteria belong to?

subject: Science
text: What are the main differences between gymnosperms and angiosperms?

subject: Science
text: Gymnosperms have naked seeds in cones, while angiosperms have seeds enclosed in fruits and produce flowers.

subject: Science
text: Why are ferns placed in the plant kingdom while frogs are in the animal kingdom?

subject: Science
text: Ferns are autotrophic with cell walls (plant characteristics), while frogs are heterotrophic without cell walls (animal characteristics).

subject: Science
text: Honey bees are social insects belonging to the phylum Arthropoda that live in organized colonies with division of labor. They are important pollinators and honey producers.
